intro: Grosourdya incurvicalcar, commonly known as the curled calyx grosourdya, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant features elliptical, leathery leaves that are arranged alternately along its stems. Its unique floral structure includes a prominent, incurved calyx that gives it its common name. Grosourdya incurvicalcar is often found in moist, shaded habitats within mountainous regions.
